posts.name:
Adam P. Boyd
Adam P. Boyd
posts.content:
I ran a training session last week with a group of customer success professionals. 

And something interesting happened.

When I asked them how their customers defined value.

The responses were predictable:

ROI
Efficiency
Reliability



All those comfortable buzzwords we hide behind.

What hit me was how disconnected they'd become from their customers' actual experiences.

It took some real work to get them to step back and describe their customers' world without their products in it.

They were so caught up in â€œsolution-speakâ€ that they'd lost touch with the raw, human problems their customers face.

 But then something clicked.

Once they started articulating specific customer problems.

The actual pain points and challenges their customers deal with.

You could see the lightbulbs going off.

They began reconnecting with the real value they provide, not just the sanitized version we often hide behind.

It was a powerful reminder of how easy it is to lose sight of the human element in customer success when we get too comfortable with our corporate vocabulary.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Hey there. I'm. I write an above-average newsletter about sales growth, and you can sign up for it here:

comments.commentText: Client experience is something that needs to be paid attention to. Happy and satisfied clients spread the word. Just like unhappy ones.

posts.commentAdded: What a compelling reminder! Reconnecting with customer pain points truly unlocks the real value we deliver. Letâ€™s keep it human!

posts.name:
Ian Koniak
Ian Koniak
posts.content:
When you try to sell, you repel.

If your deals aren't closing, it may be time to look inward and examine your intentions.

The "sale" is simply an outcome of serving your customers at the highest level.

If you want to sell more, focus on serving first. Here's how:

1. Understand where your customer needs help
2. Have an authentic conversation. Actively listen and dig deep. Ditch the pitch.
3. If you know you can help your customers, prove it! Show them how your solution will directly help solve their problem.

That's it. Simple, but not easy.

Selling is helping.

Remember, this is for them, not you!

The best way to sell is stop trying to sell, and focus on serving from the heart instead.

People don't care what you know until they know you care.

comments.commentText: spot on! selling is servingâ€”when you shift the focus to genuinely helping the sales naturally follow

posts.commentAdded: Absolutely! Focusing on genuine service over sales transforms the process. Authentic connections build trust and drive success. Great insights!

posts.name:
Priyank Ahuja
Priyank Ahuja
posts.content:
Living a happy & fulfilling life doesn't depend on your high salary!

With the right mindset and smart strategies, you can make the most of your financial situation and create a fulfilling life.

Here are 5 practical strategies to help you live a great life on a low salary:

[1] Shift to a Smaller City:
- Consider relocating to a smaller city or town where the cost of living is lower.
- Smaller cities often offer more affordable housing options, lower transportation costs, and reduced expenses overall.
- By choosing a location that aligns with your budget, you can stretch your income further and improve your quality of life.

[2] Build a Remote/Virtual Career:
- Embrace the digital age and explore remote work opportunities.
- With advancements in technology, many industries now offer remote job options.
- Look for remote positions that align with your skills and interests, allowing you to work from the comfort of your own home or anywhere in the world.
- Building a remote career can provide flexibility and potentially open up higher-paying opportunities.

[3] Start Investing in Low-Commission Products:
- Despite a low salary, it's important to prioritize saving and investing.
- Look for investment products with low commissions and fees to make the most of your savings.
- Consider options such as low-cost index funds, which provide diversification and long-term growth potential without the high costs associated with actively managed funds.

[4] Become Time Rich if Not Money Rich:
- To maximize your time, invest it wisely by upskilling yourself.
- Improve your skills and knowledge to build a strong portfolio and boost your chances of getting a higher salary or a better job.
- Don't forget, investing in yourself is a valuable long-term strategy that brings more opportunities and financial rewards.

[5] Complete Financial Obligations:
- Take charge of your financial obligations and prioritize paying off any debts or financial burdens.
- Create a budget that allows you to meet your obligations while still saving for the future.
- By tackling your financial responsibilities head-on, you can reduce stress and create a solid foundation for a great life.

Embrace these practical strategies and start creating a life that brings you joy, regardless of your income level.

If you need further guidance on navigating your career or managing your finances, contact me for a consultation and let's work together to create a path towards your desired future.

Followfor more!

If you need assistance in career guidance, interview preparation, and resume review, book a session at www(dot)priyankahuja(dot)com

comments.commentText: Great insights!  Its empowering to know that a fulfilling life isnt solely tied to a high salary. Embracing these strategies can truly make a difference!

Priyank Ahuja, your strategies for living well on a modest income are truly inspiring. Have you considered adding volunteer work to enrich life further?  
hashtag
#LifeWisdom

posts.commentAdded: Great insights! ğŸŒŸ Its amazing how mindset and strategy can transform our financial outlook and overall happiness. Lets embrace these changes!

What if bikes could navigate chaotic city streets without a rider? Self-driving cars were once dismissed as fantasyâ€”now theyâ€™re mainstream. Why should bikes be any different?

Self-driving bikes could revolutionize urban mobility: solving last-mile delivery, reducing congestion, and enabling smarter cities. But hereâ€™s the real questionâ€”are we ready?

The challenge isnâ€™t just technology. Itâ€™s about rethinking infrastructure, addressing safety concerns, and confronting societal acceptance. Not to different btw, with
.
